page.title: 18THE SAN CLU HOTEL
page.content: Some distance along the Victoria Parade is the San Clu Hotel built in 1833.It was first called the Saint Cloud although the block had originally been called Granville Terrace-it was renamed in 1920. In 1926 it opened as a hotel and for many years was the biggest hotel in Ramsgate.It had five storeys and over 70 rooms. In 1928 only two years after opening a very bad fire destroyed the western end costing Â£20,000 damage.The shell still stands today just as the firemen left it.The cause of the fire is still unknown but it destroyed 20 rooms leaving 54 rooms today. The hotel can cater for 101 people and 32 staff are employed.The hotel always has enjoyed a good reputation and is very much a typical medium sized hotel in a small seaside holiday resort.
